result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Shea Geraty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/schooling or combination thereof of at least 30 hours per week.

No contact with P.R.O.  

Absolute sobriety.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case Called: 11:20 a.m.
INCLUDES: 14CF809 & 16CM578
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person with Atty Kenneth Andraski.

TIME AND DATE SET FOR MOTION HEARING on Motion to Dismiss in 16CM578
Atty Andraski moves to dismiss Motion.
COURT grants.

TIME AND DATE SET FOR SENTENCING HEARING.
State notes that defendant has NOT complied with all terms and conditions of deferred entry agreement.
State moves for entry of judgment in Ct. 1 in 14CF809; COURT grants and finds defendant guilty.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
16CM578
Ct. 2 (BJ-MISD)>> DRI
COURT grants above.

PLEA: 
16CM578
Ct. 1 (Obstructing)>> No Contest

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
16CM578 Ct. 1- S/H 1 year probation to run concurrent to 14CF809.
14CF809 Ct. 1- S/H 3 years probation to run concurrent to 16CM578. 

CONDITIONS: Comply with WI Sex Offender Registry; No Contact with victim named in 14CF809 initials P.R.O; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof of at least 30 hours per week; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

No contact with victim(s):  P.R.O. & no unsupervised contact with female minors unless with someone 25 years of age or older.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
